lead_paragraph: Some victims of the shooting had their sexuality revealed accidentally. But for some, the massacre spurred coming out. “I just had to let them know,” said one 19-year-old who told his parents.

byline.contributor: John Eligon and Frances Robles contributed reporting from Orlando, and Samantha Schmidt from New York.

headline.print_headline: Killings Drive New Urgency to Come Out
headline.main: Orlando Massacre Inspires Some to Come Out as Gay

snippet: Some victims of the shooting had their sexuality revealed accidentally. But for some, the massacre spurred coming out. “I just had to let them know,” said one 19-year-old who told his parents.
abstract: Orlando massacre has inspired several gay survivors to come out to their families and friends in largely Latino community; some survivors, as well as some of the dead, had their identities revealed accidentally, while others have chosen to open up following tragedy; many families have chosen to embrace their children’s sexuality.
